segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is, just standing there while the sink overflows.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but at least they’re not making the mess worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at her to turn off the faucet already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is going to fall, and she’s still drying that stupid plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for cookies, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand how oblivious the woman is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets, and she’s just going to keep polishing dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shaking her to make her notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s a complete disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me so frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR
